009package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
015
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
018import imagingbook.common.math.exception.MaxIterationsExceededException;
019
020/**
021 * Eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a real matrix. This code has been ported from
022 * https://math.nist.gov/javanumerics/jama/ (Version 1.0.3), with the public API
023 * (and some internals) adapted to Apache Commons Math. Most comments below were
024 * taken from the original sources.
025 * <p>
026 * This is intended as a temporary substitute for Apache Commons Math's
027 * implementation ({@link org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition},
028 * whose symmetry tolerance appears to be too low and thus returns complex
029 * eigenvalues for close-to-symmetric matrices although solutions with real
030 * eigenvalues exist.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * If A is symmetric, then A = V*D*V' where the eigenvalue matrix D is diagonal
034 * and the eigenvector matrix V is orthogonal. I.e. A =
035 * V.times(D.times(V.transpose())) and V.times(V.transpose()) equals the
036 * identity matrix.
037 * </p>
038 * <p>
039 * If A is not symmetric, then the eigenvalue matrix D is block diagonal with
040 * the real eigenvalues in 1-by-1 blocks and any complex eigenvalues, lambda +
041 * i*mu, in 2-by-2 blocks, [lambda, mu; -mu, lambda]. The columns of V represent
042 * the eigenvectors in the sense that A*V = V*D, i.e. A.times(V) equals
043 * V.times(D). The matrix V may be badly conditioned, or even singular, so the
044 * validity of the equation A = V*D*inverse(V) depends upon V.cond().
045 * </p>
046 * <p>
047 * See Appendix Sec. B.5 of [1] for more details.
048 * </p>
049 * <p>
050 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; 
051 * An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
052 * </p>
053 * 
054 * @author WB
055 * @version 2022/06/19
056 * 
057 * @see EigenDecompositionApache
058 * @see Eigensolver2x2
059 */
060public class EigenDecompositionJama implements RealEigenDecomposition {
061        
062        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
063        public static final double DefaultZeroTolerance = 1e-12;
064        public static final int SchurMaxIterations = 30;
065
066        private final int n;                    // row and column dimension (square matrix).
067        private final boolean issymmetric;      // symmetry flag.
068        private final double[] d;               // real parts of eigenvalues.
069        private final double[] e;               // imaginary parts of eigenvalues.
070        private final double[][] V;             // array for internal storage of eigenvectors.
071        
072        private double[][] H;                   // array for internal storage of nonsymmetric Hessenberg form.
073        private double[] ort;                   // working storage for nonsymmetric algorithm.
074        
075        private final double symmetryTol;
076        private final double zeroTol;
077
078        /**
079         * Constructor. Checks for symmetry, then constructs the eigenvalue
080         * decomposition.
081         * 
082         * @param M           matrix to be decomposed
083         * @param symmetryTol absolute threshold for determining matrix symmetry
084         * @param zeroTol     absolute threshold for determining zero matrix entries
085         * @throws MaxIterationsExceededException 
086         *              if the maximum number of iterations is exceeded (see {@link #SchurMaxIterations})
087         */
088        public EigenDecompositionJama(RealMatrix M, double symmetryTol, double zeroTol)
089                        throws MaxIterationsExceededException {
090                
091                final double[][] A = M.getData();
092                this.symmetryTol = symmetryTol;
093                this.zeroTol = zeroTol;
094                this.n = M.getColumnDimension();
095                this.V = new double[n][n];
096                this.d = new double[n];
097                this.e = new double[n];
098                
099                this.issymmetric = Matrix.isSymmetric(M, this.symmetryTol);
100
101//              issymmetric = true;
102//              for (int j = 0; (j < n) & issymmetric; j++) {
103//                      for (int i = 0; (i < n) & issymmetric; i++) {
104//                              issymmetric = (A[i][j] == A[j][i]);
105//                      }
106//              }
107
108                if (issymmetric) {
109                        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
110                                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
111                                        V[i][j] = A[i][j];
112                                }
113                        }
114                        tred2();        // Tridiagonalize.
115                        tql2();         // Diagonalize.
116
117                } else {
118                        this.H = new double[n][n];
119                        this.ort = new double[n];
120                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
121                                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
122                                        H[i][j] = A[i][j];
123                                }
124                        }
125                        orthes();       // Reduce to Hessenberg form.
126                        hqr2();         // Reduce Hessenberg to real Schur form.
127                }
128        }
129        
130        /**
131         * Constructor using default tolerance setting.
132         * See also {@link #DefaultSymmetryTolerance},  {@link #DefaultZeroTolerance}.
133         * 
134         * @param M matrix to be decomposed
135         */
136        public EigenDecompositionJama(RealMatrix M) {
137                this(M, DefaultSymmetryTolerance, DefaultZeroTolerance);
138        }
139        
140        // ------------------------ Public Methods ------------------------
141        
142        /**
143         * Returns true if the decomposed matrix is considered symmetric.
144         * See also {@link #EigenDecompositionJama(RealMatrix, double, double)},
145         * {@link #DefaultSymmetryTolerance}.
146         * 
147         * @return true if symmetric, false otherwise
148         */
149        public boolean isSymmetric() {
150                return this.issymmetric;
151        }
152
153        /**
154         * Return the matrix of eigenvectors, which are its column
155         * vectors.
156         * 
157         * @return the matrix of eigenvectors
158         */
159        @Override
160        public RealMatrix getV() {
161                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V);
162        }
163        
164        /**
165         * Return the transpose of the eigenvector matrix.
166         * The eigenvectors are the rows of the returned matrix.
167         * 
168         * @return the transposed matrix of eigenvectors
169         */
170        public RealMatrix getVT() {
171                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V).transpose();
172        }
173        
174         /**
175     * Returns a copy of the specified eigenvector, i.e., the
176     * associated column vector of the matrix returned
177     * by {@link #getV()}.
178     * 
179     * @param k index of the eigenvector (counting from 0).
180     * @return a copy of the k-th eigenvector
181     */
182        @Override
183    public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
184        double[] ev = new double[n];
185        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
186                ev[i] = V[i][k];
187        }
188        return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(ev);
189    }
190
191        /**
192         * Return the real parts of the eigenvalues
193         * @return real(diag(D))
194         */
195        @Override
196        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
197                return d;
198        }
199
200        /**
201         * Return the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues
202         * @return imag(diag(D))
203         */
204        public double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
205                return e;
206        }
207        
208        @Override
209        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k) {
210                return d[k];
211        }
212        
213        public double getImagEigenvalue(int k) {
214                return e[k];
215        }
216        
217        /**
218     * Returns whether the calculated eigenvalues are complex or real.
219     * The method performs a zero check on each element of the
220     * {@link #getImagEigenvalues()} array and returns {@code true} if any
221     * element is not equal to zero.
222     *
223     * @return {@code true} if any of the eigenvalues is complex, {@code false} otherwise
224     */
225        @Override
226    public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
227        for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++) {
228            if (Math.abs(e[i]) > zeroTol) {
229                return true;
230            }
231        }
232        return false;
233    }
234        
235//      /**
236//       * Return the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix
237//       * @return D
238//       */
239//      public RealMatrix getD() {
240//              final double[][] D = new double[n][n];
241//              for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
242//                      for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
243//                              D[i][j] = 0.0;
244//                      }
245//                      D[i][i] = d[i];
246//                      if (e[i] > 0) {
247//                              D[i][i + 1] = e[i];
248//                      } else if (e[i] < 0) {
249//                              D[i][i - 1] = e[i];
250//                      }
251//              }
252//              return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(D);
253//      }
254    
255    /**
256     * Gets the block diagonal matrix D of the decomposition.
257     * D is a block diagonal matrix.
258     * Real eigenvalues are on the diagonal while complex values are on
259     * 2x2 blocks {{real pos imaginary}, {neg imaginary, real}}.
260     * WB: Wonder if indexes are safe!
261     *
262         * @return D
263         */
264        @Override
265        public RealMatrix getD() {
266                RealMatrix D = MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d);
267                for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++) {
268                        if (e[i] > zeroTol) {
269                                D.setEntry(i, i + 1, e[i]);
270                        } else if (e[i] < -zeroTol) {
271                                D.setEntry(i, i - 1, e[i]);
272                        }
273                }
274                return D;
275        }
276        
277        /**
278     * Calculates and returns the determinant of the decomposed matrix.
279     *
280     * @return the determinant of the matrix.
281     */
282    public double getDeterminant() {
283        double determinant = 1.0;
284        for (double lambda : d) {
285            determinant = determinant * lambda;
286        }
287        return determinant;
288    }
289
290        // ------------------------ Private Methods ------------------------
291
292        // Symmetric Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
293        private void tred2() {
294                // This is derived from the Algol procedures tred2 by
295                // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
296                // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
297                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
298                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
299                        d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
300                }
301
302                // Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
303                for (int i = n - 1; i > 0; i--) {
304                        // Scale to avoid under/overflow.
305                        double scale = 0.0;
306                        double h = 0.0;
307                        for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
308                                scale = scale + Math.abs(d[k]);
309                        }
310                        if (scale == 0.0) {
311                                e[i] = d[i - 1];
312                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
313                                        d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
314                                        V[i][j] = 0.0;
315                                        V[j][i] = 0.0;
316                                }
317                        } else {
318                                // Generate Householder vector.
319                                for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
320                                        d[k] /= scale;
321                                        h += d[k] * d[k];
322                                }
323                                double f = d[i - 1];
324                                double g = Math.sqrt(h);
325                                if (f > 0) {
326                                        g = -g;
327                                }
328                                e[i] = scale * g;
329                                h = h - f * g;
330                                d[i - 1] = f - g;
331                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
332                                        e[j] = 0.0;
333                                }
334
335                                // Apply similarity transformation to remaining columns.
336                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
337                                        f = d[j];
338                                        V[j][i] = f;
339                                        g = e[j] + V[j][j] * f;
340                                        for (int k = j + 1; k <= i - 1; k++) {
341                                                g += V[k][j] * d[k];
342                                                e[k] += V[k][j] * f;
343                                        }
344                                        e[j] = g;
345                                }
346                                f = 0.0;
347                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
348                                        e[j] /= h;
349                                        f += e[j] * d[j];
350                                }
351                                final double hh = f / (h + h);
352                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
353                                        e[j] -= hh * d[j];
354                                }
355                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
356                                        f = d[j];
357                                        g = e[j];
358                                        for (int k = j; k <= i - 1; k++) {
359                                                V[k][j] -= (f * e[k] + g * d[k]);
360                                        }
361                                        d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
362                                        V[i][j] = 0.0;
363                                }
364                        }
365                        d[i] = h;
366                }
367
368                // Accumulate transformations.
369                for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
370                        V[n - 1][i] = V[i][i];
371                        V[i][i] = 1.0;
372                        final double h = d[i + 1];
373                        if (h != 0.0) {
374                                for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
375                                        d[k] = V[k][i + 1] / h;
376                                }
377                                for (int j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
378                                        double g = 0.0;
379                                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
380                                                g += V[k][i + 1] * V[k][j];
381                                        }
382                                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
383                                                V[k][j] -= g * d[k];
384                                        }
385                                }
386                        }
387                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
388                                V[k][i + 1] = 0.0;
389                        }
390                }
391                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
392                        d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
393                        V[n - 1][j] = 0.0;
394                }
395                V[n - 1][n - 1] = 1.0;
396                e[0] = 0.0;
397        }
398
399        // Symmetric tridiagonal QL algorithm.
400        private void tql2() {
401                // This is derived from the Algol procedures tql2, by
402                // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
403                // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
404                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
405                for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
406                        e[i - 1] = e[i];
407                }
408                e[n - 1] = 0.0;
409
410                double f = 0.0;
411                double tst1 = 0.0;
412                final double eps = Math.pow(2.0, -52.0);
413                for (int l = 0; l < n; l++) {
414                        // Find small subdiagonal element
415                        tst1 = Math.max(tst1, Math.abs(d[l]) + Math.abs(e[l]));
416                        int m = l;
417                        while (m < n) {
418                                if (Math.abs(e[m]) <= eps * tst1) {
419                                        break;
420                                }
421                                m++;
422                        }
423
424                        // If m == l, d[l] is an eigenvalue,
425                        // otherwise, iterate.
426                        if (m > l) {
427                                int iter = 0;
428                                do {
429                                        iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
430                                        // Compute implicit shift
431                                        double g = d[l];
432                                        double p = (d[l + 1] - g) / (2.0 * e[l]);
433                                        double r = Math.hypot(p, 1.0);
434                                        if (p < 0) {
435                                                r = -r;
436                                        }
437                                        d[l] = e[l] / (p + r);
438                                        d[l + 1] = e[l] * (p + r);
439                                        final double dl1 = d[l + 1];
440                                        double h = g - d[l];
441                                        for (int i = l + 2; i < n; i++) {
442                                                d[i] -= h;
443                                        }
444                                        f = f + h;
445
446                                        // Implicit QL transformation.
447                                        p = d[m];
448                                        double c = 1.0;
449                                        double c2 = c;
450                                        double c3 = c;
451                                        final double el1 = e[l + 1];
452                                        double s = 0.0;
453                                        double s2 = 0.0;
454                                        for (int i = m - 1; i >= l; i--) {
455                                                c3 = c2;
456                                                c2 = c;
457                                                s2 = s;
458                                                g = c * e[i];
459                                                h = c * p;
460                                                r = Math.hypot(p, e[i]);
461                                                e[i + 1] = s * r;
462                                                s = e[i] / r;
463                                                c = p / r;
464                                                p = c * d[i] - s * g;
465                                                d[i + 1] = h + s * (c * g + s * d[i]);
466
467                                                // Accumulate transformation.
468                                                for (int k = 0; k < n; k++) {
469                                                        h = V[k][i + 1];
470                                                        V[k][i + 1] = s * V[k][i] + c * h;
471                                                        V[k][i] = c * V[k][i] - s * h;
472                                                }
473                                        }
474                                        p = -s * s2 * c3 * el1 * e[l] / dl1;
475                                        e[l] = s * p;
476                                        d[l] = c * p;
477
478                                        // Check for convergence.
479                                } while (Math.abs(e[l]) > eps * tst1);
480                        }
481                        d[l] = d[l] + f;
482                        e[l] = 0.0;
483                }
484
485                // Sort eigenvalues and corresponding vectors.
486                for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
487                        int k = i;
488                        double p = d[i];
489                        for (int j = i + 1; j < n; j++) {
490                                if (d[j] < p) {
491                                        k = j;
492                                        p = d[j];
493                                }
494                        }
495                        if (k != i) {
496                                d[k] = d[i];
497                                d[i] = p;
498                                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
499                                        p = V[j][i];
500                                        V[j][i] = V[j][k];
501                                        V[j][k] = p;
502                                }
503                        }
504                }
505        }
506
507        // Nonsymmetric reduction to Hessenberg form.
508        private void orthes() {
509                // This is derived from the Algol procedures orthes and ortran,
510                // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
511                // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
512                // Fortran subroutines in EISPACK.
513                final int low = 0;
514                final int high = n - 1;
515                
516                for (int m = low + 1; m <= high - 1; m++) {
517
518                        // Scale column.
519
520                        double scale = 0.0;
521                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
522                                scale = scale + Math.abs(H[i][m - 1]);
523                        }
524                        if (scale != 0.0) {
525                                // Compute Householder transformation.
526                                double h = 0.0;
527                                for (int i = high; i >= m; i--) {
528                                        ort[i] = H[i][m - 1] / scale;
529                                        h += ort[i] * ort[i];
530                                }
531                                double g = Math.sqrt(h);
532                                if (ort[m] > 0) {
533                                        g = -g;
534                                }
535                                h = h - ort[m] * g;
536                                ort[m] = ort[m] - g;
537
538                                // Apply Householder similarity transformation
539                                // H = (I-u*u'/h)*H*(I-u*u')/h)
540                                for (int j = m; j < n; j++) {
541                                        double f = 0.0;
542                                        for (int i = high; i >= m; i--) {
543                                                f += ort[i] * H[i][j];
544                                        }
545                                        f = f / h;
546                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
547                                                H[i][j] -= f * ort[i];
548                                        }
549                                }
550
551                                for (int i = 0; i <= high; i++) {
552                                        double f = 0.0;
553                                        for (int j = high; j >= m; j--) {
554                                                f += ort[j] * H[i][j];
555                                        }
556                                        f = f / h;
557                                        for (int j = m; j <= high; j++) {
558                                                H[i][j] -= f * ort[j];
559                                        }
560                                }
561                                ort[m] = scale * ort[m];
562                                H[m][m - 1] = scale * g;
563                        }
564                }
565
566                // Accumulate transformations (Algol's ortran).
567                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
568                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
569                                V[i][j] = (i == j ? 1.0 : 0.0);
570                        }
571                }
572
573                for (int m = high - 1; m >= low + 1; m--) {
574                        if (H[m][m - 1] != 0.0) {
575                                for (int i = m + 1; i <= high; i++) {
576                                        ort[i] = H[i][m - 1];
577                                }
578                                for (int j = m; j <= high; j++) {
579                                        double g = 0.0;
580                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
581                                                g += ort[i] * V[i][j];
582                                        }
583                                        // Double division avoids possible underflow
584                                        g = (g / ort[m]) / H[m][m - 1];
585                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
586                                                V[i][j] += g * ort[i];
587                                        }
588                                }
589                        }
590                }
591        }
592
593//      // Complex scalar division (old)
594//      private transient double cdivr, cdivi;
595//
596//      @Deprecated
597//      private void cdivOld(final double xr, final double xi, final double yr, final double yi) {
598//              double r, d;
599//              if (Math.abs(yr) > Math.abs(yi)) {
600//                      r = yi / yr;
601//                      d = yr + r * yi;
602//                      cdivr = (xr + r * xi) / d;
603//                      cdivi = (xi - r * xr) / d;
604//              } else {
605//                      r = yr / yi;
606//                      d = yi + r * yr;
607//                      cdivr = (r * xr + xi) / d;
608//                      cdivi = (r * xi - xr) / d;
609//              }
610//      }
611        
612    /**
613     * Performs a division of two complex numbers.
614     *
615     * @param xr real part of the first number
616     * @param xi imaginary part of the first number
617     * @param yr real part of the second number
618     * @param yi imaginary part of the second number
619     * @return result of the complex division
620     */
621    private Complex cdiv(final double xr, final double xi,
622                         final double yr, final double yi) {
623        return new Complex(xr, xi).divide(new Complex(yr, yi));
624    }
625
626        // Nonsymmetric reduction from Hessenberg to real Schur form.
627        private void hqr2() {
628                // This is derived from the Algol procedure hqr2,
629                // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
630                // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
631                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
632                
633                // Initialize
634                final int nn = this.n;
635                int n = nn - 1;
636                final int low = 0;
637                final int high = nn - 1;
638                final double eps = Math.pow(2.0, -52.0);
639                double exshift = 0.0;
640                double p = 0, q = 0, r = 0, s = 0, z = 0, t, w, x, y;
641
642                // Store roots isolated by balanc and compute matrix norm
643                double norm = 0.0;
644                for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
645                        if (i < low | i > high) {
646                                d[i] = H[i][i];
647                                e[i] = 0.0;
648                        }
649                        for (int j = Math.max(i - 1, 0); j < nn; j++) {
650                                norm = norm + Math.abs(H[i][j]);
651                        }
652                }
653
654                // Outer loop over eigenvalue index
655                int iter = 0;
656                while (n >= low) {
657                        // Look for single small sub-diagonal element
658                        int l = n;
659                        while (l > low) {
660                                s = Math.abs(H[l - 1][l - 1]) + Math.abs(H[l][l]);
661                                if (s == 0.0) {
662                                        s = norm;
663                                }
664                                if (Math.abs(H[l][l - 1]) < eps * s) {
665                                        break;
666                                }
667                                l--;
668                        }
669
670                        // Check for convergence
671                        // One root found
672                        if (l == n) {
673                                H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
674                                d[n] = H[n][n];
675                                e[n] = 0.0;
676                                n--;
677                                iter = 0;
678                                // Two roots found
679                        } else if (l == n - 1) {
680                                w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
681                                p = (H[n - 1][n - 1] - H[n][n]) / 2.0;
682                                q = p * p + w;
683                                z = Math.sqrt(Math.abs(q));
684                                H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
685                                H[n - 1][n - 1] = H[n - 1][n - 1] + exshift;
686                                x = H[n][n];
687
688                                // Real pair
689                                if (q >= 0) {
690                                        if (p >= 0) {
691                                                z = p + z;
692                                        } else {
693                                                z = p - z;
694                                        }
695                                        d[n - 1] = x + z;
696                                        d[n] = d[n - 1];
697                                        if (z != 0.0) {
698                                                d[n] = x - w / z;
699                                        }
700                                        e[n - 1] = 0.0;
701                                        e[n] = 0.0;
702                                        x = H[n][n - 1];
703                                        s = Math.abs(x) + Math.abs(z);
704                                        p = x / s;
705                                        q = z / s;
706                                        r = Math.sqrt(p * p + q * q);
707                                        p = p / r;
708                                        q = q / r;
709
710                                        // Row modification
711                                        for (int j = n - 1; j < nn; j++) {
712                                                z = H[n - 1][j];
713                                                H[n - 1][j] = q * z + p * H[n][j];
714                                                H[n][j] = q * H[n][j] - p * z;
715                                        }
716
717                                        // Column modification
718                                        for (int i = 0; i <= n; i++) {
719                                                z = H[i][n - 1];
720                                                H[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * H[i][n];
721                                                H[i][n] = q * H[i][n] - p * z;
722                                        }
723
724                                        // Accumulate transformations
725                                        for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
726                                                z = V[i][n - 1];
727                                                V[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * V[i][n];
728                                                V[i][n] = q * V[i][n] - p * z;
729                                        }
730
731                                        // Complex pair
732                                } else {
733                                        d[n - 1] = x + p;
734                                        d[n] = x + p;
735                                        e[n - 1] = z;
736                                        e[n] = -z;
737                                }
738                                n = n - 2;
739                                iter = 0;
740                                // No convergence yet
741                        } else {
742                                // Form shift
743                                x = H[n][n];
744                                y = 0.0;
745                                w = 0.0;
746                                if (l < n) {
747                                        y = H[n - 1][n - 1];
748                                        w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
749                                }
750
751                                // Wilkinson's original ad hoc shift
752                                if (iter == 10) {
753                                        exshift += x;
754                                        for (int i = low; i <= n; i++) {
755                                                H[i][i] -= x;
756                                        }
757                                        s = Math.abs(H[n][n - 1]) + Math.abs(H[n - 1][n - 2]);
758                                        x = y = 0.75 * s;
759                                        w = -0.4375 * s * s;
760                                }
761
762                                // MATLAB's new ad hoc shift
763                                if (iter == 30) {
764                                        s = (y - x) / 2.0;
765                                        s = s * s + w;
766                                        if (s > 0) {
767                                                s = Math.sqrt(s);
768                                                if (y < x) {
769                                                        s = -s;
770                                                }
771                                                s = x - w / ((y - x) / 2.0 + s);
772                                                for (int i = low; i <= n; i++) {
773                                                        H[i][i] -= s;
774                                                }
775                                                exshift += s;
776                                                x = y = w = 0.964;
777                                        }
778                                }
779
780                                iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
781                                if (iter > SchurMaxIterations) {
782                                        throw new MaxIterationsExceededException(SchurMaxIterations);   // wilbur added as safeguard
783                                }
784
785                                // Look for two consecutive small sub-diagonal elements
786                                int m = n - 2;
787                                while (m >= l) {
788                                        z = H[m][m];
789                                        r = x - z;
790                                        s = y - z;
791                                        p = (r * s - w) / H[m + 1][m] + H[m][m + 1];
792                                        q = H[m + 1][m + 1] - z - r - s;
793                                        r = H[m + 2][m + 1];
794                                        s = Math.abs(p) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r);
795                                        p = p / s;
796                                        q = q / s;
797                                        r = r / s;
798                                        if (m == l) {
799                                                break;
800                                        }
801                                        if (Math.abs(H[m][m - 1]) * (Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r)) < eps
802                                                        * (Math.abs(p) * (Math.abs(H[m - 1][m - 1]) + Math.abs(z) + Math.abs(H[m + 1][m + 1])))) {
803                                                break;
804                                        }
805                                        m--;
806                                }
807
808                                for (int i = m + 2; i <= n; i++) {
809                                        H[i][i - 2] = 0.0;
810                                        if (i > m + 2) {
811                                                H[i][i - 3] = 0.0;
812                                        }
813                                }
814
815                                // Double QR step involving rows l:n and columns m:n
816                                for (int k = m; k <= n - 1; k++) {
817                                        final boolean notlast = (k != n - 1);
818                                        if (k != m) {
819                                                p = H[k][k - 1];
820                                                q = H[k + 1][k - 1];
821                                                r = (notlast ? H[k + 2][k - 1] : 0.0);
822                                                x = Math.abs(p) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r);
823                                                if (x != 0.0) {
824                                                        p = p / x;
825                                                        q = q / x;
826                                                        r = r / x;
827                                                }
828                                        }
829                                        if (x == 0.0) {
830                                                break;
831                                        }
832                                        s = Math.sqrt(p * p + q * q + r * r);
833                                        if (p < 0) {
834                                                s = -s;
835                                        }
836                                        if (s != 0) {
837                                                if (k != m) {
838                                                        H[k][k - 1] = -s * x;
839                                                } else if (l != m) {
840                                                        H[k][k - 1] = -H[k][k - 1];
841                                                }
842                                                p = p + s;
843                                                x = p / s;
844                                                y = q / s;
845                                                z = r / s;
846                                                q = q / p;
847                                                r = r / p;
848
849                                                // Row modification
850
851                                                for (int j = k; j < nn; j++) {
852                                                        p = H[k][j] + q * H[k + 1][j];
853                                                        if (notlast) {
854                                                                p = p + r * H[k + 2][j];
855                                                                H[k + 2][j] = H[k + 2][j] - p * z;
856                                                        }
857                                                        H[k][j] = H[k][j] - p * x;
858                                                        H[k + 1][j] = H[k + 1][j] - p * y;
859                                                }
860
861                                                // Column modification
862
863                                                for (int i = 0; i <= Math.min(n, k + 3); i++) {
864                                                        p = x * H[i][k] + y * H[i][k + 1];
865                                                        if (notlast) {
866                                                                p = p + z * H[i][k + 2];
867                                                                H[i][k + 2] = H[i][k + 2] - p * r;
868                                                        }
869                                                        H[i][k] = H[i][k] - p;
870                                                        H[i][k + 1] = H[i][k + 1] - p * q;
871                                                }
872
873                                                // Accumulate transformations
874
875                                                for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
876                                                        p = x * V[i][k] + y * V[i][k + 1];
877                                                        if (notlast) {
878                                                                p = p + z * V[i][k + 2];
879                                                                V[i][k + 2] = V[i][k + 2] - p * r;
880                                                        }
881                                                        V[i][k] = V[i][k] - p;
882                                                        V[i][k + 1] = V[i][k + 1] - p * q;
883                                                }
884                                        } // (s != 0)
885                                } // k loop
886                        } // check convergence
887                } // while (n >= low)
888
889                // Backsubstitute to find vectors of upper triangular form
890
891                if (norm == 0.0) {
892                        return;
893                }
894
895                for (n = nn - 1; n >= 0; n--) {
896                        p = d[n];
897                        q = e[n];
898
899                        // Real vector
900                        if (q == 0) {
901                                int l = n;
902                                H[n][n] = 1.0;
903                                for (int i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
904                                        w = H[i][i] - p;
905                                        r = 0.0;
906                                        for (int j = l; j <= n; j++) {
907                                                r = r + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
908                                        }
909                                        if (e[i] < 0.0) {
910                                                z = w;
911                                                s = r;
912                                        } else {
913                                                l = i;
914                                                if (e[i] == 0.0) {
915                                                        if (w != 0.0) {
916                                                                H[i][n] = -r / w;
917                                                        } else {
918                                                                H[i][n] = -r / (eps * norm);
919                                                        }
920
921                                                        // Solve real equations
922
923                                                } else {
924                                                        x = H[i][i + 1];
925                                                        y = H[i + 1][i];
926                                                        q = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i];
927                                                        t = (x * s - z * r) / q;
928                                                        H[i][n] = t;
929                                                        if (Math.abs(x) > Math.abs(z)) {
930                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-r - w * t) / x;
931                                                        } else {
932                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-s - y * t) / z;
933                                                        }
934                                                }
935
936                                                // Overflow control
937
938                                                t = Math.abs(H[i][n]);
939                                                if ((eps * t) * t > 1) {
940                                                        for (int j = i; j <= n; j++) {
941                                                                H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
942                                                        }
943                                                }
944                                        }
945                                }
946                                // Complex vector
947                        } else if (q < 0) {
948                                int l = n - 1;
949                                // Last vector component imaginary so matrix is triangular
950                                if (Math.abs(H[n][n - 1]) > Math.abs(H[n - 1][n])) {
951                                        H[n - 1][n - 1] = q / H[n][n - 1];
952                                        H[n - 1][n] = -(H[n][n] - p) / H[n][n - 1];
953                                } else {
954//                                      cdiv(0.0, -H[n - 1][n], H[n - 1][n - 1] - p, q);
955                                        Complex cpx = cdiv(0.0, -H[n - 1][n], H[n - 1][n - 1] - p, q);
956                                        H[n - 1][n - 1] = cpx.getReal();        //cdivr;
957                                        H[n - 1][n] = cpx.getImaginary();               //cdivi;
958                                }
959                                H[n][n - 1] = 0.0;
960                                H[n][n] = 1.0;
961                                for (int i = n - 2; i >= 0; i--) {
962                                        double ra, sa, vr, vi;
963                                        ra = 0.0;
964                                        sa = 0.0;
965                                        for (int j = l; j <= n; j++) {
966                                                ra = ra + H[i][j] * H[j][n - 1];
967                                                sa = sa + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
968                                        }
969                                        w = H[i][i] - p;
970
971                                        if (e[i] < 0.0) {
972                                                z = w;
973                                                r = ra;
974                                                s = sa;
975                                        } else {
976                                                l = i;
977                                                if (e[i] == 0) {
978                                                        // cdiv(-ra, -sa, w, q);
979                                                        Complex cpx = cdiv(-ra, -sa, w, q);
980                                                        H[i][n - 1] = cpx.getReal();    //cdivr;
981                                                        H[i][n] = cpx.getImaginary();   //cdivi;
982                                                } else {
983
984                                                        // Solve complex equations
985
986                                                        x = H[i][i + 1];
987                                                        y = H[i + 1][i];
988                                                        vr = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i] - q * q;
989                                                        vi = (d[i] - p) * 2.0 * q;
990                                                        if (vr == 0.0 & vi == 0.0) {
991                                                                vr = eps * norm * (Math.abs(w) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(x) + Math.abs(y) + Math.abs(z));
992                                                        }
993//                                                      cdiv(x * r - z * ra + q * sa, x * s - z * sa - q * ra, vr, vi);
994                                                        Complex cpx1 = cdiv(x * r - z * ra + q * sa, x * s - z * sa - q * ra, vr, vi);
995                                                        H[i][n - 1] = cpx1.getReal();   //cdivr;
996                                                        H[i][n] = cpx1.getImaginary();  //cdivi;
997                                                        if (Math.abs(x) > (Math.abs(z) + Math.abs(q))) {
998                                                                H[i + 1][n - 1] = (-ra - w * H[i][n - 1] + q * H[i][n]) / x;
999                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-sa - w * H[i][n] - q * H[i][n - 1]) / x;
1000                                                        } else {
1001//                                                              cdiv(-r - y * H[i][n - 1], -s - y * H[i][n], z, q);
1002                                                                Complex cpx2 = cdiv(-r - y * H[i][n - 1], -s - y * H[i][n], z, q);
1003                                                                H[i + 1][n - 1] = cpx2.getReal();       //cdivr;
1004                                                                H[i + 1][n] = cpx2.getImaginary();      //cdivi;
1005                                                        }
1006                                                }
1007
1008                                                // Overflow control
1009
1010                                                t = Math.max(Math.abs(H[i][n - 1]), Math.abs(H[i][n]));
1011                                                if ((eps * t) * t > 1) {
1012                                                        for (int j = i; j <= n; j++) {
1013                                                                H[j][n - 1] = H[j][n - 1] / t;
1014                                                                H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
1015                                                        }
1016                                                }
1017                                        }
1018                                }
1019                        }
1020                }
1021
1022                // Vectors of isolated roots
1023                for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
1024                        if (i < low | i > high) {
1025                                for (int j = i; j < nn; j++) {
1026                                        V[i][j] = H[i][j];
1027                                }
1028                        }
1029                }
1030
1031                // Back transformation to get eigenvectors of original matrix
1032                for (int j = nn - 1; j >= low; j--) {
1033                        for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
1034                                z = 0.0;
1035                                for (int k = low; k <= Math.min(j, high); k++) {
1036                                        z = z + V[i][k] * H[k][j];
1037                                }
1038                                V[i][j] = z;
1039                        }
1040                }
1041        }
1042        
1043        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1044        
1045        public static void main(String[] args) {
1046                
1047                // 2 examples where Apache's implementation fails:
1048                
1049                // non-symmetric example:
1050//              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]  
1051//                      {{4455707.000000000, 16685.500000000, 17344.500000000, 142.000000000}, 
1052//                      {-951005821.436619800, -3525507.007042253, -4059917.288732395, -33371.000000000}, 
1053//                      {-997789920.901407700, -4059917.288732392, -3879630.838028166, -34689.000000000}, 
1054//                      {70029373562.509700000, 297685588.322852130, 314485277.997519970, 2949430.845070420}});
1055                
1056                // symmetric example:
1057                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
1058                        {{-635322.712034708800000, 4756.174679968795000, -265184.797553499500000, 20382.684252847448000}, 
1059                        {4756.174679968796000, 560670.646574945200000, 0.190328961575323, -0.016193729208773}, 
1060                        {-265184.797553499500000, 0.190328961575416, 74652.065423977560000, 1.470729864949432}, 
1061                        {20382.684252847444000, -0.016193729208773, 1.470729864949432, 0.000035786438260}});
1062                
1063                // singular matrix
1064//              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
1065//                              {{2, 1, 0},
1066//                              {0, 2, 0},
1067//                              {0, 0, 0}});
1068                
1069                // singular matrix
1070//                              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
1071//                                              {{2, 1, 4, -1},
1072//                                              {3, -2, 1, 0},
1073//                                              {5, 1, -3, 2},
1074//                                              {-1, 3, 3, -1}});
1075                
1076                PrintPrecision.set(9);
1077                
1078                System.out.println("det(M) = " + Matrix.determinant(M));
1079                System.out.println("symmetric(M) = " + MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(M, 1e-12));
1080                System.out.println("singular(M) = " + Matrix.isSingular(M));
1081                
1082                {
1083                        System.out.println("\nJAMA: *****************************");
1084                        EigenDecompositionJama ed = new EigenDecompositionJama(M);
1085                        System.out.println("evalsRe = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getRealEigenvalues()));
1086                        System.out.println("evalsIm = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getImagEigenvalues()));
1087                        System.out.println("has complex evs = " + ed.hasComplexEigenvalues());
1088                        System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getD()));
1089                        System.out.println("V = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getV()));
1090                }
1091                
1092                {
1093                        System.out.println("\nApache Commons Math: *****************************");
1094                        org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition  ed = 
1095                                        new org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition(M);
1096                        System.out.println("evalsRe = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getRealEigenvalues()));
1097                        System.out.println("evalsIm = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getImagEigenvalues()));
1098                        System.out.println("has complex evs = " + ed.hasComplexEigenvalues());
1099                        System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getD()));
1100                        System.out.println("V = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getV()));
1101                }
1102        }
1103        
1104        
1105}
